text: Leslie Bricusse, OBE (29 January 1931 â€“ 19 October 2021) was a British composer, lyricist, and playwright. He wrote the music and lyrics for the movies Doctor Dolittle, Goodbye, Mr. Chips, Scrooge, Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory and Tom and Jerry: The Movie. He also wrote the songs "Goldfinger", "You Only Live Twice", "Can You Read My Mind (Love Theme)" (with John Williams) from Superman and "Le Jazz Hot!" with Henry Mancini. Bricusse won two Academy Awards in 1968 and 1983. He also won a Grammy Award in 1963. Bricusse died on 19 October 2021 in Saint-Paul-de-Vence, France.
